lines.text: [Nicholas van Orten loses a shoe when climbing a fire-escape ladder]
There goes a thousand dollars.
Your shoes cost a thousand dollars?
That one did.
They just fuck you and they fuck you and they fuck you, and then just when you think it's all over, that's when the real fucking starts!
Discovering the object of the game *is* the object of the game.
So, you've played recently?
Oh, about a year ago. I was working in Los Angeles.
I hear the London office is very good, too. It just sounds like a lot of fantasy, role-playing nonsense.

[leans in]
You wanna know what it is? What it's all about?
[Nicholas leans closer]
I... haven't been to Sunday school in a long time.
'Whereas once I was blind, now I can see.'
[rises]
Good night, Nicholas. Best of luck.
Good night.
I don't care about the money. I'm pulling back the curtain. I want to meet the wizard.
This was the best one *ever*!

[shakes Nicholas's hand]
You know, thank God you jumped, because if you didn't, I was supposed to throw you off!

[leveling gun at carjacker]
I am extremely fragile right now.
This is for you.
You shouldn't have.
What do you get for the man who has... everything?

[reading card]
"Consumer Recreation Services." Well, I do have golf clubs.
Call that number.
Why?
Make your life... fun.
Fun.
You know what that is... uh, you've seen other people have it.
What's that?

[signs document]
This... is... the bill.
Do you want to split it?

[exhales]
Oh God yes! I'll take some of that...
[shows Nicholas enormous number at bottom of receipt]

[shocked look]
Oh my God...

And you really believe that just because you publish children's books, people are going to care about my reputation? You can have pictures of me wearing nipple rings, butt-fucking Captain Kangaroo. The only thing they care about is the stock and whether that stock is up or down!
They won't leave me alone! I'm a goddam human piñata!

[Nicholas is making rounds at his birthday party]
Nicholas, I haven't a *clue* what's going on, but your taste in champagne is excellent, as always.
It was a *great* entrance!

[on TV]
There's a tiny camera looking at you right now.
That's impossible.
You're right, impossible. You're having a conversation with your television.

[on TV]
A staggering 57% of American workers believe there is a very real chance they will be unemployed in the next 5 to 7 years. But what does that matter to a bloated millionaire fat-cat like you?
I'm being toyed with by a bunch of depraved children
The game is tailored specifically to each participant. Think of it as a great vacation, except you don't go to it, it comes to you.
We're like an experiential Book-of-the-Month Club.
No, what is this? What are you... selling?
Oh. It's a game.

[In the stopped elevator]
I'll give you a boost.
You first.
This isn't an attempt to be gallant. If I don't lift you, how are you going to get there?
You pull me up.
It's much easier this way. Come on, step up...
No.
Please...
I'm not wearing underwear. Okay? There, I said it. Satisfied?

[Looks at her skirt]
Oh. Fine.
You don't know anything about society, Marie; you don't have the satisfaction of avoiding it.
What *is* the going rate for a trapped-in-an-elevator adventure?
[last lines]
Would you like to have coffee with me at the airport?
October 12th, Nicky's birthday.
October 11th.
Whatever.
You can't smoke here.
I'm with you.
It's illegal to smoke in restaurants in California.
Fuck California!
[In a fancy restaurant]
I've been here before.
I took you here for your birthday.
No, I used to buy crystal meth from the Maitre D.
Did I have a choice? Did I have a choice?
You got a shower in your office?
Yeah.
You an athlete or something?
No, I'm an investment banker.
Seymour Butts. Never get tired of that one.
I got this key out of a mouth of this... wooden clown.
...Never mind.

[when he and Christine wind up in composters]
Dinner for two, please.
You know, I envy you. I wish I could go back and do it for the first time, all over again. Here's to new experiences.
